sourcing.instructions: B (Boron powder) from chemical suppliers; Cu (Copper powder) from metal supply stores; La (Lanthanum oxide) from specialty chemical suppliers; Nd (Neodymium oxide) from rare earth material suppliers; Ni (Nickel powder) from metal supply retailers.
steps: B (Boron powder) from chemical suppliers; Cu (Copper powder) from metal supply stores; La (Lanthanum oxide) from specialty chemical suppliers; Nd (Neodymium oxide) from rare earth material suppliers; Ni (Nickel powder) from metal supply retailers.

1. Measure out the precise amounts of each ingredient using an analytical balance. 2. Combine B, Cu, La, Nd, and Ni in a clean, dry mixing bowl. 3. Use a mortar and pestle or mechanical mixer to thoroughly mix the powders for at least 10 minutes to ensure uniformity.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure out the precise amounts of each ingredient using an analytical balance. 2. Combine B, Cu, La, Nd, and Ni in a clean, dry mixing bowl. 3. Use a mortar and pestle or mechanical mixer to thoroughly mix the powders for at least 10 minutes to ensure uniformity.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace preheated to 1200°C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure proper fusion of materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace preheated to 1200°C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure proper fusion of materials.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally. 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has cooled to prevent thermal shock to the crucible.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally. 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has cooled to prevent thermal shock to the crucible.

steps: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample to precise dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches if necessary. 3. Sand the edges and surfaces with progressively finer sandpaper (e.g., 400, 600, and 1200 grit) to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally apply a sealant or protective coating if required for environmental protection.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample to precise dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches if necessary. 3. Sand the edges and surfaces with progressively finer sandpaper (e.g., 400, 600, and 1200 grit) to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally apply a sealant or protective coating if required for environmental protection.
